title: COAST ORB / shadowchurch
description: You feel the shadow of a very large building fall on you.

title: COAST ORB / thickice
description: The ice here is thick enough to walk on.

title: COAST ORB / longwaydown
description: It's a long way down to your death from here. 20 metres at least.

title: COAST ORB / barredshutconvo
description: The boards crack dangerously as you run. Be careful here.

title: JAM / RACIST
description: You chat up a truck driver of the racist persuasion.

title: PLAZA / ANNETTE
description: Daughter of the book shop clerk is standing outside with a small book stand in order to make the shop more inviting. You chat her up.

title: JAM / RACIST CABIN
description: You can view the racist lorryman's cabin to get a load of his racist paraphernalia.

title: KIM SWITCH / RACIST KITSURAGI
description: Dialogue about if you are down the racism. Triggers some distance after leaving the lorry driver (it's hooked up to the Kim switchboard).

title: ICE / CHURCH DOOR
description: Initiating the Get Into The Church TO-DO

title: ICE / TENT FLAP
description: Entering the tent and leaving Kim behind.

title: ICE / EGGHEAD
description: Side-dialogue. Has the Physical Instrument check that makes Andre's Composure dance check easier and initiates the TO:DO - Make Van Eyck's jam more hard core

title: ICE / ANDRE
description: Talking to the speedfreaks' leader

title: BACKYARD / MOTHER OF ALL WALLS
description: Stop everything and direct all attention to that wall -- it's sublime!

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / ashtray
description: Looks like she left a nice long stub in the ashtray. It's still smoking.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / dialogue cigarette stub
description: ashtray dialogue / TASK find smokes

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / dialogue home
description: where is home, what is home afterthought

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / Communist Quest Initiation
description: Rhetoric tells you it's time to bone up on dialectical materialism and get organized.

title: Get yourself organised
description: You can't build communism alone. It's time to join your revolutionary brethren, develop your political consciousness, and put Mazovian theory into practice. But where have all the communists gone?

title: GATES ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

title: APT / COMMUNIST MEETING DOOR
description: Door leading to the Storage Room where the Secret Communist Meeting takes place. (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

title: APT / STUDENT COMMUNIST
description: The Student Communist and his underground reading group (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

title: PIER ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

title: INVENTORY / LA FUMEE
description: Vol. 1 No. 2 of *La Fumée*, Martinaise's leading quarterly journal of radical Mazovian thought (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

title: INVENTORY / INFRA-MATERIALISM GUIDE
description: An Introduction to the Theories of Ignus Nilsen (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / Moralist Quest Initiation
description: Empathy tells you it's time to take responsibility... by convening a committee to spread responsibility around.

title: Take on *la responsabilité*
description: Things down here are a *mess*. Someone really ought to do something about it. First, though, you and some other moralists should probably form a committee to decide whose job it is.

title: JAM / COALITION WARSHIP ARCHER -- NOID VERSION
description: CUTSCENE where you attempt to contact Coalition Warship Archer with NOID. PART OF THE MORALIST DREAM QUEST

title: OFFICE / SECRETARYS RADIO
description: You can remove the transceiver from this radio as part of the MORALIST DREAM QUEST

title: COAST ORB / Empathy Afterthought
description: There's no way you'll reach the Coalition with this piece of junk...

title: WESTCOAST / SUNDAY FRIEND
description: PART OF THE MORALIST DREAM QUEST. You come across the Sunday friend enjoying the historical scenery. You also have the chance to apologise if you accused him earlier.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / Ultraliberal Quest Initiation
description: Savoir Faire tells you it's time to stop playing the market and make some real cash so you can fulfil your heart's desire.

title: Become a man of plenty
description: No more messing around. It's time to get rich for real! Just play the market right and you'll be a millionaire by the end of the week. Then you can get what your heart desires. Whatever it is...

title: PIER ORB / ultraliberal quest pre-cindy
description: Savoir Faire spots Cindy and gives you a pep talk before you try to negotiate for her art.

title: CONTAINERYARD ORB / ultraliberal dream quest
description: Savoir Faire hears wealth humming in the container -- whether it's raised or lowered. Also gives you instant access to MRLBG.

title: INVENTORY / STOCK CERTIFICATE
description: Read the Stock Certificate traded with MRLBG

title: JAM / MONUMENT REFLECTION
description: After the Tribunal, Harry reflects on the re-conceptualization of the horseback monument by Idiot Doom Spiral. (ULTRALIBERAL DREAM QUEST)

title: GATES / SCAB LEADER
description: Scab Leader, a large mercenary in disguise. Shouts a lot about LETTING US WORK, doesn't actually provide much information for now, except being suspicious and shouting.

title: GATES / MANANA
description: A jolly, easy-going man at the very bottom entrance to the gates. He gives information about the scabs, the strike, the union boss, Measurehead and being a boiadeiro.

title: ICE / NOID
description: Noid dialogue -- happens mostly inside church.

title: GATES / MEASUREHEAD
description: An übermensch monolith guarding the button to the harbour office door. Into "science"-anthropometry based racial theory.

title: WHIRLING / SLEEPING DOCKWORKER
description: Downstairs at the Whirling In Rags there's a sleeping dockworker. Interfacing people can steal his wallet and work pass, Phys inst can wake him up by yelling and then get some info on the Union and the strike.

title: PLAZA / RENE
description: René is in the shade, the forlorn option who's losing at the game.

title: PLAZA ORB / gaston cheating
description: Cheating!

title: PLAZA / RENE barks
description: Playing pétanque.

title: PLAZA / GASTON barks
description: Playing pétanque and cheating.

title: PLAZA ORB / crack
description: Some great tectonic force has cracked the pavement, like an eggshell.

title: Talk to Garte, Lieutenant Love
description: Garte + Sylvie = ?? Something's going on here. You need to help a brother out with his love-woes. Go to Garte and give him some solid advice. Tell him how it *is* with women.

title: Where is the rest of the armour?
description: The hanged man's armour seems to be missing. Find out what happened to it. The kid throwing rocks at the corpse seems to be a good place to start. (Ask him about the body first.)

title: CANAL ORB / waterlock sign afterthought
description: Is this the water lock Lena mentioned?

title: CHURCH ORB / took cut of lab
description: Aha, the drug lab! Can't wait for the profits to start rolling in...

title: Inspect the traps
description: Check the traps for Morell the cryptozoologist, so he and his friend Gary can get some rest. There are four traps in total. After checking them all, return to Morell with the news.

title: COAST ORB / feldwindowsbars
description: Bars cover these long, dusty windows.

title: COAST ORB / dizzyingheights
description: The gusts of wind, the height feels dizzying.

title: COAST ORB / bunkerseen
description: This is the bunker window.

title: Return to the dead body with Kim
description: There's a dead body on the Martinaise boardwalk down the coast. Return to it with the lieutenant and decide what to do with it.

title: ICE ORB / eternite logic
description: Before you, a drawbridge. It can only be lowered from the other side.

title: COAST ORB / cormorant reaction
description: To your right, a white-bellied cormorant eyes you suspiciously.

title: APT ORB / dont run
description: Don't run, okay? Take it slow when exploring the apartment. Be respectful.

title: What happened to the previous forewoman?
description: There are rumours that the previous forewoman of the Union just disappeared, right before the Claires took over. Her daughter called in on the election eve and said she wasn't running any more -- or coming to work. What happened?

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / dialogue pants
description: These are your sleek pants. Put them on and find THE KEY to get out of your room.

title: WHIRLING / Kim barks
description: Kim tells you he has a menu for questions after he's in the team.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / mess hall door
description: A sign reads: "Mess hall reserved for Union members. Doors open: 16:00."

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / mess hall window
description: Inside you catch a glimpse of Union paraphernalia: a strike poster, some red pennants.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / water cooler
description: This is a water cooler. A large bubble is rising to the surface.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / menu
description: The menu has been wiped clean. Only the word MONDAY is written on it.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / sound from kitchen
description: The soft purr of an electric juicer comes from the kitchen. Someone is working.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / kitchen door
description: The door is bolted. A sign reads: "Kitchen reserved for personnel until 13.00."

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / handwriting
description: A woman's hand wrote yesterday's menu. Today's starts in a man's handwriting.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / sea smell
description: The smell of the sea makes you dizzy.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / wind gush
description: A gust of briny wind washes over you.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / broken pinball
description: This Royal Pinball machine is unplugged.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / royalism theme
description: royalism themed afterthought

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / spilled rum
description: A bottle of rum has been knocked over. Beautiful, dark liquid is spilling out...

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / trompe le monde
description: This is the weekend edition of the satirical newspaper "Trompe le Monde".

title: YARD ORB / trash container logo
description: The letter "R" wears a crown. On the ribbon below: "A Light Above Descending."

title: YARD ORB / tree ladder
description: This kids' ladder is rickety but still climbable.

title: YARD ORB / ladder logic
description: The ladder's for kids -- it wouldn't hold the weight of a grown man.

title: YARD ORB / greenhouse
description: Someone is trying to grow herbs in this greenhouse.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / balcony door
description: A sign on the door says the balcony is closed for spring.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / commodore red
description: This magnum-sized bottle of "Commodore Red" is empty.

title: JAM / INSTIGATOR CABIN
description: The Instigator is gone but you can still explore the cabin of her abandoned vehicle. This yields some MAJOR foreshadowing.

title: BOOKSTORE / PLAISANCE
description: Inside the book shop. Speaking with the proprietor.

title: BOOKSTORE / CURTAINS
description: The curtains hanging in front of the back room. Curious trinkets attached. Very suspect. Can open, but Plaisance doesn't like that.

title: WHIRLING F2 / KLAASJE DOOR
description: When the dialogue with Klaasje is over you can go and click and her door.

title: Find the Insulindian Phasmid
description: You've volunteered to restock the empty trap for the cryptozoologists. They even gave you fresh box of locusts. This could, after some messing around, *probably* lead to the discovery?

title: PLAZA / WORKING CLASS DRUNK barks
description: Barks from a working class man with a drinking problem. Triggers an authority orb if you've met the working class woman.

title: PLAZA / WORKING CLASS WOMAN
description: [Aimée.] A dialogue with a woman who has a job. And a husband. And kids.

title: PLAZA ORB / get a drink
description: Start drinking (Electrochem).

title: PLAZA ORB / working class husband
description: AUTHORITY: It's a working class woman's drunk husband.

title: PLAZA / COIN-OPERATED VIEWER I
description: A coin-operated viewer on the plaza. It offers a view to the sunken sea-fort.

title: PLAZA / COIN-OPERATED VIEWER II
description: A coin-operated viewer on the plaza. It offers a view to the church.

title: PLAZA ORB / coin-operated viewer III
description: This coin operated viewer has been banged up, inoperable.

title: WHIRLING F2 / RADIO barks
description: A radio tuned to an interisolar weather-station.

title: Find booze and drink it
description: The hangover feels really bad. You have to take the edge off. Find a bottle of alcohol, put it in your hand (equip it in the HELD slot in your INVENTORY), and the magic will happen by its own!

title: Getting the body down
description: Somehow make it so that the bloated corpse isn't up there any more. Shoot it down or ask for help. Do something, you're a cop.

title: Find working class husband
description: The working class woman you met in front of the bookstore admitted that her husband is missing. Chances are the guy is drinking somewhere with his buddies. Find him and bring him home, if possible.

title: BACKYARD / STONE
description: First follow-up convo with Kim where you discover keys under the stone.

title: BACKYARD / KIM barks
description: Kim barks when you step in the courtyard.

title: BACKYARD / SMOKER ON THE BALCONY
description: The balcony overlooks the scene of the hanging but he's not a witness. He told as much to the investigator before, who you can ascertain was from Whitewater: foreshadowing for the HONOUR COURT's arrival later. EDITED VERSION

title: FRITTE / FRITTE CLERK
description: A dialogue with a bored teenage girl who works as a shop clerk.

title: FRITTE / TARE MACHINE
description: Right next to the glass-doored fridge.

title: JAM / HUMANITARIAN AID
description: Siileng, the humanitarian aid guy!

title: JAM ORB / broken security seals
description: The lead seals that secure the goods have been broken off.

title: JAM ORB / hum aid macaronis
description: Plastic-wrapped macaronis stamped with 'Humanitarian Aid'.

title: JAM / faln sneakers on a pedestal of speakers
JAM ORB / humanox
description: A bold slogan "HUMANOX" covers the truck.

title: JAM ORB / logic orb
description: logic afterthought about the humanitarian guy being all suspicious and whatnot

title: JAM ORB / hum aid tunafish
description: This says: 'Humanitarian Aid Tunafish. NOT FOR RESALE'.

title: JAM ORB / hum aid speakers
description: This says: 'Speakers from the People of Samara'.

title: JAM ORB / hum aid food
description: This says: 'Food Gift from the People of MESSINA'.

title: DOOMED / ELECTRONIC DOORBELL
description: This is a doorbell intercom that lets you call up all the failed businesses in the Doomed Commercial Area.

title: DOOMED / DICEMAKER
description: New thought: The Precarious World

title: DOOMED / CENTRAL FURNACE
description: This is an industrial oven on the first floor of Doomed. You can interact with it and contact Dicemaker.

title: DOOMED / BREAKER BOX
description:
Doomed cellar, breaker box. DONE. 

Get task finished for locate a fridge if you need to plug the fridge back in.

title: DOOMED / ICE CREAM MAKER
description: Doomed cellar, a pistachio green ice cream maker next to the breaker box with a radio computer's filament memory inside. Difficulty: heroic, turns into easy if you've read the note from the Ice Bear Fridge.

title: DOOMED / ICE BEAR FRIDGE
description:
1. Has a note inside that points to the frozen ice cream maker that has the filament memory stored inside.
2. Reacting to the fact that there's a giant ice bear fridge still running them a loss.
3. This is where you put the hanged man. If hub reached then this is an instant solution for TASK.find_fridge / If has TASK.find_fridge then this is the solution.
4. The fridge can be turned off from the breaker box.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / intercom wires
description: Intercom wires running into the breaker box.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / cellar window
description: A cellar window: people's feet shuffling by on the street.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / frozen ice cream maker
description: A frozen ice cream maker that's still running.

title: DOOMED / HIDDEN WEAPONS CACHE
description: Weapons hidden inside the wall. Kim reacts to the room (revolution etc) and you obtain an antique rifle that it seems to have a bullet in it. Lootable item: antique_rifle. You can get a bullet and compare it with the hanged man's.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / old weapons
description: Two rusty rifles are hidden above the piping; they look inoperable.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / more old weapons
description: Someone has stuck some busted guns beneath the ceiling.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / coal chute
description: The wind howls in from the coal chute above.

title: DOOMED S1 ORB / regular ice cream maker
description: An ice cream maker, defrosted and unplugged.

title: Help Revachol Ice City cut losses
description: Help Revachol Ice City cut their losses by plugging out the giant ice bear fridge. It's located in the cellar of the Doomed Commercial Area.

title: FRITTE / KNICK-KNACKS STAND
description: The counter.

title: FRITTE / APOTHECARY
description: A small cabinet on the wall, right next to the posters.

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / punchbag
description: Sand is dripping from a punchbag...

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / wallbars
description: Worn-out wallbars. They look unsafe.

title: DOOMED / BARBELL
description: You can lift the barbell.

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / windows
description: The hallway is blocked by old windowpanes and debris.

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / fashionthought
description: But where are the clothes it used to display?

title: JAM / TOMMY
description: At the plaza, near Kim's Kineema you may talk to an anxious truck driver. The man's come to stretch his legs. Here you will find information on: traffic jam, the closed gates, the other truck drivers, FALN. + Learn some background on the geography of Le Caillou. Possibly acquire one piece of the FALN clothing set. (Includes poetry white check.)

title: INVENTORY / GREATEST INNOSSENCE
description: "The Greatest Innocence" by João Paolo Salomao Lopez de Fuego.

title: BOOKSTORE / COCKATOO
description: From A to Zrieek! Guide to a Well-Behaved Cockatoo. (Helen)

title: INVENTORY / HJELMWOMAN
description: Man from Hjelmdall and the Devil Woman.

title: INVENTORY / WIRRAL MODULE
description: Super-popular binoclard fantasy board game (module), feat. faeries and welkin and pygmies and such fantasy folk. The non-grimdark pastoral-bucolic version with maps & miniatures. Basic Wirral info.

title: DELETE THIS FOLDER
description: delete

title: DELETE THIS FOLDER
description: delete

title: GATES ORB / mysteryeyes
description: There's a mysterious pair of eerie eyes peeking through the gap between the main gates.

title: GATES / BABEONE barks
description: One of Measurehead's awesomely hot companions who barks mocking stuff at you (on clicking).

title: GATES / ANOTHERBABE barks
description: One of Measurehead's awesomely hot companions who barks mocking stuff at you (on clicking).

title: GATES ORB / harbour sounds
description: Rumbling and creaking can be heard from behind the large gates.

title: GATES ORB / interfacing afterthought
description: There's no lockpicking or door-kicking this one.

title: GATES / WOMENS RIGHTS first phase barks
description: Barks for WR protester. If it comes out interesting and fun, and not some sort of boring shit unimaginative garbage.

title: GATES / CHILLBABE barks
description: Third of Measurehead's awesomely hot companions who also maybe barks mocking stuff at you (on clicking). Or might not, if she's the one sitting behind Measurehead, out of your reach.

title: GATES / MYSTERIOUS EYES
description: Interactable object (the gap in the gates) leads to a dialogue with the spooky pair of eyes.

title: The Jam Mystery
description: Someone's using Terminal B to smuggle raw ingredients of drugs into Revachol. Joyce said there are 3 drivers at the intersection. Talk to them, one of them *must* know something about the drug trade.

title: Call your station's lazareth
description: Kim suggested you call the station lazareth in order to sort out your health issues. You can use his motor carriage to make the call, although you don't feel hopeful.

title: Investigate Doomed Commercial Area
description: People say the commercial building on the plaza is cursed; no business will ever thrive there without going bankrupt. You promised Plaisance you'll look into it. Enter the sealed door behind the bookstore and find out what happened to the companies there.

title: GATES ORB / noticesign
description: A notice: "IN CASE OF A STRIKE -- PRESS BUTTON BEHIND GUARD"

title: JAM / RACIST barks
description: barks for the bark god, blood for the blood throne!

title: JAM ORB / cargohold
description: Goods from the lorry haphazardly litter the surroundings.

title: JAM ORB / tendetectives
description: A glossy magazine: "Most Able-Bodied Men". This issue hosts a top 10 list.

title: JAM ORB / detectivethought
description: Oh, no! They're *much* hunkier than you!

title: JAM ORB / trash bin
description: A sticker on the bin reads: "RCM Emergencies Desk no 8-100-2. Mankind, be vigilant!"

title: JAM ORB / frittethought
description: Three Ts! How idiomatic.

title: JAM ORB / frittestore
description: FRITTTE (SIC!)

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / millionart
description: A vaguely androgynous portrait of a man.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / hairdrier
description: Ghostly silhouettes of hairdriers.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / hairdrierthought
description: No sane person would ever put their head in to such machine.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / millionstar
description: Looks like Guillaume Le Million... that hair poster.

title: BOOKSTORE / PRIMERBOOK
description: A primer-book (quest item for Arx)

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / greatideas
description: A quaint picture book brochure. Very colourful.

title: WHIRLING F2 / TEQUILA DOOR
description: The dialogue between you and the door to your room. It is locked unless you've paid for damages.

title: VILLAGE / SHACK DOOR
description: The shack door dialogue, if you have gained access to the shack where you can sleep. It's locked until you get it from the Washerwoman.

title: VILLAGE / NETPICKER
description: You see a middle-aged woman with a tea-length skirt, rubber boots and a rain jacket. Brown, curly hair, a sword on her side. She doesn't notice you.

title: VILLAGE / BOAT
description: This is the boat you can get from the Net picker. This boat takes you to the Sea Fortress island.VILLAGE ORB / ask boat from netpicker

title: WHIRLING F1 / GORACY KUBEK
description: A dialogue with a kojko cook Gorący Kubek. He doesn't speak a word from your language, but for some reason understands all your questions about disposing the corpse??

title: VILLAGE ORB / boat
description: The underside of the boat has recently been tarred.

title: End-of-day debrief with Kim
description: Kim can answer any lingering questions you may have about the case and the RCM. Join him on the Whirling-in-Rags' balcony after 22:00, when you're calling it a day.

title: KIM SWITCH / DEBRIEF DAY ONE
description:
1. Kim smokes.
2. How did the day go? 
3. What are our powers and what is the RCM?
4. What is the Moralintern? 
5. What do you think of Martinaise, Kim?

title: KIM SWITCH / DAY TWO UNION
description: Kim blinks red when he's joined your team near the stairs. He wants to tell you the vigilantes have showed up and that you should talk to them -- but be careful. (Final warning about RCM non-presence in Martinaise.)

title: WHIRLING F2 / MEDICINE CABINET
description:
Klaasje's medicine cabinet.
1) Find speed (Saint-Batiste goodstuff)
2) Find barbiturates, benzos, SOS and narcan
3) check to steal speed if kim there

title: THOUGHT / GOSSAMER STATE
description: Savoir Faire convinces you on the merits of being an Ultraliberal -- Gossamer State.

title: THOUGHT / WORLD REPUBLIC
description: Rhetoric talks about Communism --The World Republic.

title: THOUGHT / BORING COP
description: Drama informs you are a Boring Cop.

title: THOUGHT / SUPERSTAR COP
description: Composure confirms that you're a Superstar Cop.

title: THOUGHT / KINGDOM OF CONSCIENCE
description: Empathy informs you that you are a Moralist. Kingdom of Conscience awaits.

title: THOUGHT / APOCALYPSE COP
description:
Shivers is all about being an Apocalypse Cop.

Thou art the harbinger of doom, embrace thine destiny.

title: THOUGHT / SORRY COP
description:
Suggestion tells you all about being a Sorry Cop.

... I am SORRY!!! Sorry for everything! Sorry for being *me*!

title: THOUGHT / HONOUR
description: Authority discusses how you are... The rarest of police officers

title: THOUGHT / REVACHOLIAN NATIONHOOD
description: Endurance explains you are a Fascist. It's all about the Revacholian Nationhood.

title: CANAL / WORKER barks
description: Barks for workers loitering by the canal after fixing the water lock.

title: WESTCOAST / GARY
description: Gary the Cryptofascist is a friend of Morell's. Also trying to find the cryptid. Wears armour stolen from the hanged man under his clothes. Has Man from Hjelmdall books etc.

title: COAST ORB / reeds at lands end
description: These reeds are in the north, at Land's End. The interactable reeds you can search when Morell tells you to check the phasmid traps. There are traps in these reeds.

title: COAST ORB / reeds by feld
description: These reeds are somewhere near Feld. The interactable reeds you can search when Morell tells you to check the phasmid traps. There are traps in these reeds.

title: COAST ORB / reeds near sunken car
description: These reeds are near your sunken car. The interactable reeds you can search when Morell tells you to check the phasmid traps. There are traps in these reeds.

title: PLAZA / KORTENAER
description: Previously known as Scab Leader. Wears a huge and intimidating set of armour. He is drunk and pissed off at his friend getting killed. He carries a big-ass gun.

title: The Missing Insects Case
description: Some locusts have gone missing, and the Insulindian phasmid has yet to be found. Perhaps you can use your detective skills to help out the cryptozoologists?

title: SEAFORT / BOAT
description: You're gonna need to boat yourself back somehow after everything is done.

title: VILLAGE / JUDIT MINOT barks
description: your old posse; formerly: horse faced woman

title: VILLAGE / TRANT HEIDELSTAM barks
description: your old posse. formerly near FELD electrics building with his kid

title: WHIRLING F2 / KIM DOOR
description: The door to Kim's room on floor two of Whirling-in-Rags

title: HQ / WASHBASIN
description: A washbasin An interactable dialogue where you can shave your beard/muttonchops! This changes the portrait in the mirror dialogue, and the one on UI.

title: SOUTHCOAST / SUNKEN MOTOR CARRIAGE
description: Tyre tracks lead to a sunken motor carriage.

title: WHIRLING F1 / STEEL DOOR
description: The steel door in the back of the kitchen. Leads to the storage area with the elevator.

title: JAM / HORSEBACK MONUMENT
description: On the traffic island in the jam, an old monument of Filippe III The Squanderer pointing towards an unknown location in the sea. The chest region seems to have suffered chip damage.

title: APT / MAZOV BUST
description: This is the bust of Kras Mazov. Finishes "Find out if you're Kras Mazov" task.

title: APT / WCW MAIN
description: Working Class Woman in her room, apartment #20.

title: APT / TOMAS THE SPONSOR
description: The sponsor, in Smoker's apartment #28.

title: APT / CUNO DAD
description:
Cuno's dad, loitering on the bed. Drugs. Sleeping with his eyes open. His face reminds you Cuno 30 years later. Also seems like he's dead. Hairy ginger chest, in undewear. Kim reacts. Hearing redcheck while he gurgles, success: he's trying to call you pigs. 


I talked to your dad boolean. / I was somehow able to not evade your dad.

title: VILLAGE / ABIGAIL
description: Don't Call Abigail -- a member of the Union of Moribund Alcoholics, who talks about (not calling) Abigail.

title: VILLAGE / ROSEMARY
description: Rosemary (previously known as Under Control) -- the member of the Union of Moribund Alcoholics who sells you booze, smokes etc.

title: BOARDWALK / THE PIGS
description: The Pigs! Evrart arranges you to meet the woman who has been posing as a police officer. She's carrying an attachment of sirens and police lights. She's got your gun.

title: BOARDWALK / TRANT HEIDELSTAM INTRO
description:
Trant Heidelstam is chilling near the FELD building, with kid, piggy-bank. You can:
1. Learn about the FELD building.
2. Get useless advice.

title: CHURCH / MAINFRAME
description: Mainframe. Related to Doomed-Soona-questline related stuff.

title: BOARDWALK / PAYPHONE
description: Payphone, for calling folk. Call everyone.

title: CHURCH / TIAGO
description: Tiago the Crab Man.

title: CHURCH / SOONA
description: Soona the Palediver.

title: APT / SMOKER DOOR
description: DOOR, APARTMENT #28 (SMOKER ON THE BALCONY)

title: APT / WCW DOOR
description: DOOR, APARTMENT #20 (WORKING CLASS WOMAN)

title: APT / CUNO DAD DOOR
description: DOOR, APARTMENT #12

title: APT / MAZOV DOOR
description:
DOOR, APARTMENT #11 (turns into door. can lockpick and get into?)

1. Use the wirecutters to cut the chain.
If you don't have them, the door suggests it. The chain is very flimsy. 
Exactly the same structure as other doors. 

1. Observe the padlock. - the weakness here is in chain.

Option to get a task if you do not have the chaincutters.

title: Find the traffic hooligan
description: A half-insane joyrider has jumped over the canal. See if you can find evidence of his reckless activity in west, on the coast.

title: VILLAGE / JOYCE barks
description:
Joyce barks for when she's in the village.

I dared not to move it to her actual folder, cause it's already been inputted and I didn't wanna fuck it up.

title: VILLAGE / NETPICKER barks
description: NETPICKER barking

title: LANDS END / NETPICKER
description: A dialogue featuring you, Kim, Lilienne the Netpicker, about the sun (if it's rising, setting or high in the sky) -- what the sun is, what means. THE SETTING SUN

title: Meet Lilienne at Land's End
description: You have a date with Lilienne. Get to Land's End -- in the northern tip of the peninsula -- quickly, she's not going to wait for you forever.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / stew
description: An aroma of spices, alcohol, and tomato hangs in the air...

title: OFFICE ORB / file cabinet
description: A standard office file cabinet. The drawers seem to be locked.

title: HQ / EXIT BULLET difficult
description: The bullet you find in the shack, hinting that someone else has been staying here. Secretly.

title: HQ ORB / floorboard
description: The floorboards creak under your step.

title: BOOKSTORE / MAP WALL
description: Different maps attached to the wall. Including the Map of Martinaise (fast travel?)

title: BOOKSTORE / HJELMSERIES
description: A shelf full of Hjelmdall books. There are so many.

title: BOOKSTORE / ROMANCE
description: Shelf of romance books.

title: BOOKSTORE / CRIME
description: Shelf of crime books.

title: BOOKSTORE / BOARD GAME MOUNTAIN
description: A mountain of different board games.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / nomillion
description: Merely looking at that unmanly haircut threatens your masculinity.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / windoworb
description: Gift books and molten candy.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / balconyorb
description: Another boring book. Just discarded here.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / stufforb
description: The book collects the national recipes of Arda. They are all about lake trout.

title: BOOKSTORE ORB / shelforb
description: It's a... *Tome of Fascist Magic*. Rather candid.

title: BOOKSTORE / BIOGRAPHIES
description: Shelf full of biographies of famous people.

title: KIM SWITCH / JOYCE DRUGS
description: Little talk to Kim where he discusses undertaking the jam mystery w you

title: LAIR / Door to Outside
description: This prevents the player from leaving the main lair -- only fires if they have dealt with Ruby but not read her journal.

title: LAIR / Door to Stairwell
description: This prevents the player from leaving the main lair -- only fires if they have dealt with Ruby but not read her journal.

title: LAIR ORB / dark celebration 2
description: An afterthought to Ruby's scene whether she kills herself or runs away -- exists outside Ruby by Rosemary as redundancy

title: PLAZA / GASTON
description: Florid and jolly, Gaston Martin is standing in a sunspot and loudly eating a giant ham sandwich.

title: YARD / CUNOESSE
description:
Talk to Cunoesse to find out she's a girl.

"I have nothing interesting say, talk to Cuno!"

Or approach her from the backyard to catch her off-guard and have something-resembling an actual dialogue with her.

title: Replace lost boule
description: Due to some confusion over the game René and Gaston are playing, you threw one of their pétanque *boules* far in the sea. The shot was excellent, but now you owe them a *boule*... or at least similar-looking metal sphere.

title: Make truce with Cuno
description: You tried to punch Cuno and failed catastrophically. Now you need to make a truce with him to gain access to his knowledge. Offer him something he might like. Smokes? A "Man from Hjelmdall" book?

title: Find your other shoe
description: Seems like your green snakeskin shoe is missing its partner. You should find it before you go venturing into the wild unknown. Two shoes are better than one -- unite them again.

title: Interview cafeteria manager
description: The cafeteria manager of the Whirling-in-Rags might know something about the murder that happened in the yard. Ask him about it.

title: Inspect victim's body
description: Inspect the body hanging in the back yard of the Whirling-in-Rags. This is a preliminary inspection, you just need to suppress the urge to throw up and approach it.

title: Report your badge missing
description: You need to report your missing badge to the 41st Precinct as soon as possible. The lieutenant said that you can use the radio in his motorcar to call your station.

title: Find money for rent and pay Garte
description: You need to find 20 reál to pay for your room at the Whirling, or it will be locked after 21.00. As long as you don't have a free place to stay you have to do this every night.

title: Pay for damages
description: You need to pay for the damages you caused in the Whirling-in-Rags, or you won't have a place to stay tonight. Ask around for money and be careful with your spending. If you're unsure how much you owe, ask Garte.

title: Find smokes and smoke them
description: You need to get your hands on some cigarettes and then smoke them... for those massive bonuses. Find a pack, put it in your hand (equip it in the HELD slot in your INVENTORY), and the smokes will do the rest.

title: Talk to Garte for Sylvie
description: Sylvie asked you to talk to Garte and tell him she's sorry. Go to the cafeteria manager and relay the news, maybe it will help you somehow?

title: Talk to Joyce about the pale without Kim
description: Lieutenant Kitsuragi does not want you to hear about something called the *pale*, probably thinking it will prove traumatic. Return to Joyce once he is not there, and ask her about it. *Or* get him to step away for a second.

title: Track down your badge
description: It's unclear how you should go about finding a tiny piece of plastic in a world as huge as this. Maybe you'll just *stumble* across it, down the line? Miracles happen.

title: KINEEMA ORB / torque talk
description: Kim has a sweet ride, the Coupris Kineema - the sports version of the Coupris 40 police motor-carriage. You should definitely talk about it.

title: KINEEMA / SYLVIE
description: Your wildly successful phone call to Sylvie Malaiika.

title: YARD / CUNO
description:
* All greeting except "Making amends".
* Throwing up advice.
* Buy pants.

title: YARD / PILE OF ETERNITE
description: Someone has left some crumbly looking eternite panels leaning against this wall. Most suspicious.

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART
description:
Evrart Claire is the head of the Dockworkers' Union. Wealthy, lazy, smart cat - player.

In this dialogue you can:

* Enlist Evrart's aid to get the body down (he asks measurehead to do it).
* Get bent and earn a daily income by doing so (corrupt cop).
* Find out about the neighbourhood.

title: EVRART ORB / nighttime desk
description: The desk has been cleaned out for the night.

title: CONTAINERYARD / EASY-LEO
description: A simpleton dockyard-worker. Only person besides Evrart and Mega-Rich left in the container yard. He's making a banner.

title: PLAZA ORB / stone spheres
description: Enormous *boules* worthy of a real man.

title: PLAZA ORB / doomed cellar y
description: There is something down there...

title: PLAZA ORB / sea hearing
description: You hear the distant squall of seabirds.

title: APT / EMPTY ROOM DOOR
description: APARTMENT #10. A door leading to the apt with a real estate agent.

title: PLAZA ORB / erotica half light
description: The book appears to be erotica. But without actual erotica.

title: PLAZA ORB / boiadeiroculture
description: The book says you must attain a *Franconigerian hardbody*. At the nearest gym.

title: PLAZA ORB / book jankaus
description: It takes willpower to even read the author's name: Jan Kaus. From Igaunia.

title: PLAZA ORB / loos radio city
description: You memorize the title: Loos, '87: Radio City. Seems important.

title: PLAZA / THE GARDENER
description: The Gardener stands on the corner of Whirling and is there to help you navigate the streets of Martinaise. Later it turns out she's a Union spy. You get to know from here that Joyce is in town.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / kim in your room
description: Kim tries not to look at your broken down bathroom door.

title: CONTAINERYARD / LEO new barks
description: Replacement barks for Leo to test out.

title: WHIRLING / SLEEPER barks
description: Zzzzzzz...

title: COAST ORB / boardwalkexplainer
description: Nothing on the boardwalk suggests the sniper shot came from here. Maybe something will turn up later?

title: COAST ORB / boardwalkagainexp
description: No trace of the hanged man's shooting *on* the boardwalk -- maybe look *under* it again?

title: Who put the clothes in the trash?
description: The victim's clothes were in the trash container out back, neatly folded. Who could have put them there, and why? Only the Whirling staff was supposed to have the key.

title: Style your paperwork
description: You and your Conceptualization skill have decided to style that paperwork so it'd be cooler somehow. Be on the lookout, but know -- this will take *time*.

title: INVENTORY / LEDGER OF FAILURE
description:
Perform a closer inspection of the ledger found in the trash (your official paperwork). Find:
1. serial number
2. forms
3. notes on cases
4. wife's letter
5. toilet smell

title: Read your ledger and name the case
description: This case needs an official name. Go to your INVENTORY, and INTERACT with the Damaged Ledger to give it one. (Finding the right line may take some time.)

title: YARD / HANGED MAN BULLET
description:
This is the final phase of the hanged man:
1. White check to find bullet
2. Failure to find fridge
3. Bagging him and taking it away

title: Wash off the death smell
description: You reek of death. Wash it off. There's a bathtub in your room in the Whirling-in-Rags. A good place to visit once you can have some privacy.

title: DOOMED / MOODBOARD
description: Fortress Accident's whiteboard. Has three sections: game-related concept art, production schedule and Soona's notes.

title: DOOMED / RADIOCOMPUTER
description: RADIOCOMPUTER -- WIRRAL UNTETHERED! HEAT DEATH!

title: PIER / JOYCE INTRO
description:
Joyce is on her boat. She welcomes you and tells you about the situation, her role in it, what happened w hanged man.
1. Finishes task: find wild pines rep
2. Finishes task: reality lowdown
2. Gives task: investigate traffic jam
3. Volition white to get 130 real

title: PIER / JOYCE LYNCHING AND TATTOOS
description:
The lynching hub
The tattoos hub

title: Joyce's info on the lynching
description: There is something she wants to tell you -- you just have to present her with your badge to hear it. *Or* perhaps if you did her a favour she could wave off the formality? Whatever the case, you need to know what she knows.

title: The victim's tattoos
description: You have a photo of the hanged man's tattoos. Maybe someone can decipher them, tell you what they mean? You should probably talk to about two people about them for this.

title: PIER / JOYCE ON EVRART
description: EVRART HUB and all such relevant information. Also tells you Discovery of Insulinde story.

title: PIER / JOYCE REALITY HUB
description: Reality hub

title: JOYCE / REALITY TIMES
description: Times part of hub, solves TASK.reality lowdown

title: Get Joyce to tell you about discovery of Insulinde
description: Joyce has said she will tell you about the discovery of the Insulindian isola, one day. You have a feeling you need to tell her things in return -- things you do for Evrart, maybe?

title: WHIRLING F1 / THE GARDENER MAIN
description: The Gardener turns out to be a Union fixer. Slightly different model and portrait. Short *smug* dialogue directing you to Hardie, referencing last dialogue.

title: WHIRLING F1 / HARDIE
description:
Titus Hardie, leader of the militant union wing Hardie Boys. Mass dialogue + Gardener and Boys:

1) Admit they lynched the man because of a rape.
2) WHITE: Rhetoric to get them to tell you Klaasje was victim (Evrart makes easier -- leads to Klaasje, Klaasje betrays)
3) React to Klaasje's betrayal
4) WHITE: Suggestion to get them to counterbetray and reveal Assassination
5) something to get them to reveal Instigator (Ruby)

title: WHIRLING F1 / HORSE FACED WOMAN
description: Horse-Faced-Woman (Minot)

title: WHIRLING F1 / MAN WITH SUNGLASSES
description: Man with Sunglasses (Vicquemare)

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / hidden door
description: There's a door there, partially obscured by posters.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / door conclusion
description: Could it lead to the same room as the kitchen door?

title: WHIRLING F1 / INDUSTRIAL STOVE
description: You can use the stove to boil the hanged man's boots when Kim is not around.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / door been there
description: It used to lead to the pinball repair shop.

title: WHIRLING F1 / SPARE WORKSHOP KEYS
description: Somewhere in the room are the previous owner's spare keys to the pinball workshop (door in kitchen). This is the (perc check hidden) dialogue where you find them. (One path to hidden access to roof)1) Mis-connect to instigator because of room

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / bills on desk
description: Hotel bill calculations. Looks like she's had an extended stay.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / dirty clothes
description: Piles of dirty clothes; a woman's.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / sad feeling
description: This room has *Sad* all over it -- reminds you of your own

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / three months of bills
description: She's made around four months of payments for this room.

title: WHIRLING F3 / CLEAR WINDOW VISCAL DIFFICULT
description: This window has been recently replaced. High perception to notice. This dialogue gets a viscal and becomes trivial once someone admits Assassination

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / astra menthol
description: The smell of cigarette smoke in the air: *Astra* Menthol.

title: WHIRLING F3 / BARRED DOOR
description:
This is the door on the roof. 
Phys Inst white get in

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / wildflowers
description: Look! A handful of dried white wildflowers...

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / handeye catch
description: hand eye coordination bubble to catch the wildflowers

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / bed
description: The bed has been hastily made.

title: WHIRLING F1 / ELEVATOR
description:
1. You experience the lovely elevator and wonder what it was used for.
2. You can go up and down.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / franconigerian conquest pinballer
description: This pinball says 'Franconigerian'. The theme is horses and swords.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / mysterious woman pinballer
description: This pinball is 'White Deora'. The backglass shows a female figure in mourning.

title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / play pinball
description:
1. Let's play pinball.
2. Kim "Pinball" Kitsuragi back story.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / tools
description: Boxes of tools and replacement parts line the shelves.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / peephole shivers
description:
1. Doomed felt.
2. This is not just a hole -- this is a peephole.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / small perforation
description: There's a tiny hole in the wall. You see a bedroom on the other side.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / pinball workshop
description:
1. This was a pinball workshop.
2. Was the Whirling-in-Rags part of the doomed commercial area task gained.

title: WHIRLING F3 / FOOTPRINTS IN THE DUST
description:
1. See tracks from what seem to be boots.
2. Reveals not odd-soled if you return after suspecting Ruby. (Anti-red-herring.)

title: Send victim's body to processing
description: Once you're done with it, send the corpse to Processing (Lieutenant Kitsuragi will take care of it). Check twice to see whether you're done with all corpse-related tasks -- after you've sent the body away, you can't take it back.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / body down
description: In the yard below a corpse lies under the pine tree.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / body up
description: In the yard below a corpse hangs from the pine tree.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / body gone
description: You see the yard below. The corpse is no longer there.

title: Find speed and sniff it
description: The hangover is coming on *mega* strong now. You need more speed in your bloodstream. Find some, put it in your hand (equip it in the HELD slot in your INVENTORY), and off we go!

title: WHIRLING F3 / CLEAR WINDOW VISCAL TRIVIAL
description: The trivial version of the window -- for when you know about Assassination

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / watching you
description: You feel someone watching you, behind the glass door -- a woman.

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / wind picks them up
description: ...the wind brushes them off the roof. They're gone.

description:
3) What happened? (rape)

description:
5) heard tape / gonna hear tape
6) Lely details

title: Who made the call reporting the crime?
description: Someone reported the hanging to the RCM. Maybe if you find out who it was, it may shed new light on the events. You have an idea where to start, but the caller could have been anyone.

title: Ask Klaasje about Sunday night
description: When Kim's not around to stop you, ask Klaasje about what she heard from her room the night before you emerged into Reality. She must know something.

title: Explore the Whirling’s secret passages
description: There are strange doors in the Whirling. No one knows where they lead. Find a way in and see what's hidden there, in the hostel cafeteria's forgotten corners.

title: KIM SWITCH / KLAASJE REACTION
description: Kim reacts to you losing your shit (Composure fail) when the Hardie boys said the victim is a young woman called Klaasje in the Whirling-in-Rags.

title: WHIRLING F3 / KLAASJE barks
description: KOSMOS! INCLUDES VO!

title: Sing karaoke
description: You need to find a sufficiently tragic tape, then play it on a boombox to memorize the lyrics. Then ask the cafeteria manager to perform. (Preferably in the evening. More people at the bar then.)

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / narcomania afterthought
description: narcomania afterthought

title: INVENTORY / DRIED MAY BELLS
description: This dialogue is attached to the "dried_may_bells" item.

title: KIM SWITCH / DISCUSSING KLAASJE DOWNSTAIRS
description: this should blink ONLY DOWNSTAIRS and after Klaasje rape hub exit

title: INVENTORY / LELY TAPE
description: tape now interactable in inventory, if you have the boombox. Lely-Kortenaer banter for interrogate Klaasje sequence

title: Doorgunner Megamix
description: Hardie gave you a recording where the hanged man supposedly testifies to his intent to rape and pillage. Have a listen on a playback device -- either in your room; or find one from a pawnshop.

title: WHIRLING F3 / KLAASJE FULL STORY
description:
6) hardie confessed, whole story (ruby leader)
7) drama white (ruby suspect)

title: Question Klaasje about the dead man
description: Klaasje told you she can't talk about him now, but you need *specifics* -- height, build, etc, to confirm your autopsy. Ask a little later, when she has collected herself.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / age afterthought
description: how old are you afterthought

title: WHIRLING F3 / KLAASJE END
description: 11) Shivers white

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / love did him in
description: did in by love afterthought

title: Make Titus give up Ruby's location
description: Ruby was the organizer of the hanging. She's also *missing*, but the Hardie boys will be tight-lipped about her location. You need to get them to open up. Have you *fully* explored the Whirling? Analysed the site of the murder? Truly and *thoroughly* interrogated Klaasje? All this might make convincing them easier.

title: Inspect Klaasje's buoy
description: There's a buoy West of the boardwalk on the coast, somewhere in the reeds. It has Miss Oranje's fake documents in it...

title: LANDS END ORB / cigarette butts
description: Cigarette butts, cleaned away under a rock: brand Tioumoutiri.

title: LANDS END ORB / rickety ladder
description: This ladder is too rusty to climb. The sea air has eaten away at it.

title: LANDS END ORB / campfire remains
description: Someone's made a campfire here, a long time ago.

title: LANDS END ORB / lands end shot viscal
description: the conclusion dialogue where you conclude the shot did not come from land's end. this fires only if you have  TASK.check_lands_end

title: Arrest Klaasje
description: There is a hidden way to arrest Klaasje and have Kim take her to Precinct 57 for safe keeping. She is not to be trusted.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / red thread inside
description: A red thread. Made of nylon. It leads out of the room and onto the roof...

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / red thread outside if did not click on thread inside
description: Red thread. Made of nylon. It leads into the room...

title: WHIRLING ROOF ORB / red thread outside if clicked on thread inside
description: The thread is tied to the antenna.

title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / red thread inside if clicked on thread outside
description: The thread is tied to a bookcase on the wall.

title: WHIRLING F2 / KIM WAKEUP
description: If you succeeded the final Authority check to warn Kim.

title: WHIRLING F2 / CUNO WAKEUP
description: If you didn't make the authority check.

title: Find solution to strike deadlock
description: There is a secret way to solve the deadlock. It's not easy, includes a lot of back and forth between the two sides, but it's possible. Everything is always possible.

title: Are you La Puta Madre's peone?
description: Ruby said you were a notoriously corrupt cop. La Puta Madre's peone. That's why she was scared of you. When you get the chance, call your station to find out more -- *if* you dare.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / fixed window
description: Newly replaced glass, shining in the morning light.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / fixed stereo 8
description: This Stereo 8 player has been reunited with its right speaker.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / fixed bathtub
description: You see gleaming white enamel. No bottles inside...

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / traffic outside
description: You hear traffic outside. Back in the world again...

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / unmade bed
description: The bed still smells of your sweat and blood.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / alarm clock
description: The alarm is set for 6:50 AM.

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / kims room door open
description: Look! The door is open! You can walk right into Kim's room.

title: WHIRLING F2 / KIM PAPERWORK
description: checking out some of kim's official paperwork on his room desk

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / first aid
description: Medicinal supplies on the cupboard: Merchurochrome, a scalpel, antibiotics...

title: WHIRLING F2 / KLAASJE'S NOTE
description: She's left you a note on her table

title: PLAZA / GRAFFITO
description:
There's a giant graffito on the plaza outside:
Un jour je serai de retour près de toi

title: Light the graffito on fire with a burning cigarette
description: What it says on the can.

title: Ask Lilienne's twins about the island
description: Lilienne mentioned they might have been there on a raft -- the twins are on the concrete yard in the middle of the village.

title: VILLAGE / LILIENNES TWINS
description: You can talk to them before and get nothing, but when you hear the twins have been to the island they tell you details about it.

title: SEAFORT ORB / ancient stairs
description: These stairs feel ancient... soldier's feet ran up them long ago.

title: SEAFORT ORB / quiet on the island
description: (afterthought on silence and sounds)

title: SEAFORT ORB / leaky barrel
description: Some fuel has leaked out of the barrel. Black, viscous.

title: SEAFORT ORB / warm air
description: Warm air -- from the inside of the building. It's warmer there than out here.

title: SEAFORT ORB / chain winch one
description: The rusted chain trails off into the ocean...

title: SEAFORT ORB / chain afterthought
description: (afterthought about chain)

title: SEAFORT ORB / barrel ICM logo
description: This barrel says: ICM. You see a star with little specks in it.

title: LANDS END ORB / depot chain
description: The chain trails off into the ocean -- to who knows where.

title: LANDS END / DEPOT DOOR
description: The door to the jammed supply depot near Land's End. The door is jammed and locked. You can't open it. EVER.

title: SEAFORT ORB / vertigo
description: Be careful not to fall... the cliff face looks steep.

title: SEAFORT ORB / birch empathy
description: The little birch from the coin operated viewer. Still holding on.

title: Find fuel for the generator
description: Find fuel, then put it in the generator upstairs (to power the console -- to open the door). There could be fuel on the island, tucked away somewhere -- explore, look around.

title: SEAFORT ORB / leaky barrel empty
description: This barrel has run empty. There's almost nothing inside.

title: SEAFORT / KIM FUEL barks
description: Kim reacts to fuel empty if task is on w/ BARK

title: SEAFORT ORB / birch normal
description: You recognize this little birch. From the coin-operated viewer.

title: SEAFORT ORB / ICM logo questions
description: (afterthought on ICM)

description: This was once an armament rest.

description: (mattress interactable) (this is where you sleep)

title: SEAFORT INT ORB / reading lamp off
description: This reading lamp is unpowered.

title: SEAFORT INT / BLAST DOOR

title: SEAFORT INT / FELD INSULAR CONSOLE
description: old electronic console – turn on lights and open blast door if fuel in generator

description: Canned food, sugar, and other foodstuffs.

description: Twin cannons were attached here. Medium distance, large calibre.

title: SEAFORT INT ORB / reading lamp on
description: The reading lamp emits a soft glow.

title: SEAFORT INT ORB / squadron flag
description: A moth-bitten bed sheet keeps the wind out.

title: SEAFORT ORB / ligature blood drip
description: Warm blood trickles down your armpit. The ligature is off... it's *nothing*.

description: you can read the book (MAYBE)

title: SEAFORT / MATTRESS NEST
description: (in front of double embrasure looking over the bay, into whirling window, ends check island task, shot was made here)

title: SEAFORT ORB / cargo ship horn
description: The distant sound of cargo ships... Signal horns echo on the water.

title: SEAFORT ORB / inland eyes

description: You take a mental note: Tioumoutiri. Seems important somehow.

title: SEAFORT ORB / bleuets
description: Small white maybells, blossoming in the sand.

Meet the Deserter, gun in hand, by the extinguished fire. 

AUTHORITY  (PSYCHE) red check

title: SEAFORT / INSULINDIAN PHASMID
description: Interact with the Insulindian phasmid.

title: SEAFORT DREAM ORB / door is unopened
description: The door is back, like you never opened it...

title: SEAFORT DREAM ORB / door is still here
description: The door is still here, closed. Feels strange somehow. You can't get in.

title: SEAFORT DREAM ORB / step into water
description: Walk into the water. Now.

title: SEAFORT DREAM ORB / really step into water
description: Now do it -- walk into the *water*.

title: SEAFORT INT / AFTERDOLORES TALK
description: Load to this from dream seafort dolores dei dialogue end.

title: What is the Race Enigma?
description: Put the Advanced Race Theory idea into a free *internalizing* slot in your head. (If there are no free slots, free one up). Then pass some time and when it's internalized, return to Measurehead. This is how thinking is done!

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / dialogue both shoes
description: both shoes on, finishes task

title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / trompe le monde afterthought
description: Nothing on the front page rings a bell. Strange...

title: YARD ORB / dialogue door strange feeling
description: The sound of melting snow dripping off the roof... it's strange.

title: PLAZA ORB / wheelbarrow
description: A heap of snow melts in this wheelbarrow.

title: BOOKSTORE / BACK DOOR
description: It's the back door of "Crime, Romance, and Biographies of Famous People". You can look at it, use a key object on it or try to force it open.

title: PLAZA / COUPRIS KINEEMA
description:
Lieutenant Kitsuragi's Coupris Kineema. With the built in shortwave radio and a trunk full of goodies, here lies the answer to the question that's been bothering you - what tore me from the soft abyss this morning.

* Gain item: Crowbar
* Gain item: bodybags
* Gain item: Chaincutters
* Gain item: Fire extinguisher
* Gain secret task: Cut something.
* Gain task: Get a Primer-book.

title: KIM SWITCH / TWINS AND RADIO
description: Fires after you've heard the Twins testimony with Kim. He reveals he knows the station. Weird if true, worth giving them a call.

title: KIM SWITCH / SPOKE TO SPEEDFREAKS
description: Speedfreaks FM confirmed that the kids heard the Speedfreaks. He doesn't know what that means or how it relates to your case, but suggests you go back to the FELD Mural.

title: Work with the Children of the Big Sea
description: The Wind spoke to you at the Feld Mural. The Children of the Big Sea know something that will assist you in finding Ruby. But who are the Children and what do they know?

title: KINEEMA / STATION CALL
description:
Your first contact with the colleagues back in station 41.

* Report your badge missing
* Report your gun missing
* Get laughed at
* Beg your station for additional funds
* Get a panic attack
* Get an aweseome Firewalker persona
* Get the "Find your badge" quest
* Get the "Find your gun" quest.
* Get the "Check the local pawnshops" quest.

title: CONTAINERYARD / CLOAK JUMP
description: You see a policeman-cloak -- jump to it. Get it. If you're above, to be precise! Otherwise, you can just pick it up or whatever.

title: CONTAINERYARD ORB / crane
description: You see faded industrial lettering on the platform: KVALSUND.

title: OFFICE / FILE CABINET

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART FAVORS
description: "You seem to be very helpful, I got a favour to ask."

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART ME
description: "You seem to know thing about me... Can I ask you about something?"

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART MR DU BOIS
description: "You called, me *Mr. Du Bois*, why?"

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART HOW I GOT HERE
description: "Aren't you going to ask me how I got in here?"

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART GUN
description:
"Let's talk about my lost gun."
&
"Can I have my lost gun now?"

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART UNION
description: "I wanna discuss some matters regarding the union with you."

title: CONTAINERYARD / EVRART MURDER
description: "I wanna talk to you about the murder."

title: Open apartment door for Evrart
description: Evrart asked you to open the basement door behind the greenhouse in the backyard, to intimidate the occupant. Do what you have to do, Evrart has promised to give you info on the case in return.

title: Get two signatures for Evrart
description: Get Isobel and Lilienne in the nameless fishing village down the coast to sign Evrart's document. Once the signatures are secured, mail the document to Evrart's accountant using the mail box on the plaza in front of the Whirling.

description: A set of disorderly footprints heading Southeast.

description: Seems the walker was either very confused or drunk out of his mind.

description: The logic white check where you present your theory of how Ruby killed Lely and get the Hardie boys to give up her approximate location.

title: The *special* borscht
description: What's so *special* about the borscht the strikers are eating? The cook in the *Whirling-in-Rags* is making it -- you can find him in the kitchen. Look into it.

description: An afterthought to Ruby's scene whether she kills herself or runs away.

description: "They didn't do it!"

description: "You are all drunk!"

title: WHIRLING / LENA INTRO

description: You look at and ask Roy about a street light.

title: Turn back the wheels of time
description: A true kingsman *cannot* stomach the grotesque parody of Old Revachol your home has become. *Assez*! Find a way to turn back time, save the Suzerainty and give *love* a second chance.

title: Interview the Sunday friend
description: You finally met up with the mysterious smoker on the balcony. He said the one you really want to talk to is his friend. This friend is waiting for you inside, in apartment #28 -- go and and meet him right now (he won't be there later).

description: Someone's siphoning electrical current from outside -- into this antenna.

title: CHURCH ORB / waterbasins
description: The bowl is filled with water. A live wire runs directly into it.

description: A large demijohn full of strange liquid...

description: Is it potable?

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / demijohn smell

title: BACKYARD / KIM APT DOOR barks

title: FRITTE / SHIMMERING WALL OF VICES
description: Alcohol + cigarettes behind the counter.

title: APT / REAL ESTATE AGENT
description: A short conversation with the real estate agent. She tells you about some apartments.

title: APT / WRITING DESK IN CUNO'S APT
description:
2 bottles of speed on the table, in plain sight. A straw in the bottle. Low-quality trucker speed. Drugs have charges, this is a low-charge one. 0 bonus to your electrochem base-count of how many times you can use the drug.

FIND THE SPEED finishes when you click on the table. While you're taking that shit, Kim is already checking the other room. Kitsuragi love goes down if you take the drugs.

Table diag despaws after you've taken the drugs.

Habit-initiation dialogue. Electrochem tells you blast one already in this dialogue. Ask Argo (abt cigarette initiation dial). It should also teach you to put it in your hold slot. 

Global afterthought, electrochem pops up

title: unfinished orb
description: Can't grab it it's upstairs orb - TO BE WRITTEN

title: APT ORB / abandoned apt shivers
description: This is a shivers orb showing the former tenant.

title: APT ORB / abandoned apt window
description: The sea below looks cold and winter-grey.

title: APT ORB / foreclosed apt fridge
description: The refrigerator has been cleaned out.

title: APT ORB / foreclosed apt table
description: An old grocery list on the table. And checks.

title: APT ORB / foreclosed apt logic

title: INITIATION / SPEED HABIT

title: APT ORB / abandoned apt window night
description: Waves crashing in the darkness.

title: APT ORB / concept revolutionaries

title: KIM SWITCH / DOOMED

description: Smells like leather and sweat.

title: DOOMED F2 ORB / contact mike poster
description: Is this Contact Mike, the boxing champion?

description: Is this Emma's Atelier?

title: KIM SWITCH / FORTRESS ACCIDENT
description: Kim talks to you about Fortress Accident.
